   (Sperchonopsella) whiteshellensis Conroy, 1991. The frst descriptions of
   the female of S. nikkoensis and the male of S. sounkyo are also given.
   The subgenus Sperchonopsella Conroy is new to the fauna of China.

DT Article; Meeting paper
TI A revision of the millipede genus Riukiupeltis Verhoeff, 1939
   (Diplopoda, Polydesmida, Paradoxosomatidae), with comments on the status
   of related species.
AU Nguyen, Anh D. (ducanh@ierb.ac.vn) 
   Korsos, Zoltan
SO ZooKeys
VL 156
SU (Special Issue)
PS 25-40
PD 2011
PY 2011
UR http://www.pensoft.net/journals/zookeys/issue/156/
AW http://www.pensoft.net/inc/journals/download.php?fileId=3553&fileTable=J
   _GALLEYS
LA English
U1 0
U2 6
AB The East Asian millipede genus Riukiupeltis Verhoeff, 1939 is revised,
   and is restricted to a single species, Riukiupeltis jamashinai Verhoeff,
   1939. Examination of the type specimens and freshly collected material
   from the Ryukyu Archipelago and Vietnam show that both subsequently
   allocated species, Riukiupeltis uenoi Murakami, 1975, and Riukiupeltis
   falcatus (originally Haplogonosoma falcatum Attems, 1953, reallocated by
   Jeekel 1968), do not belong to this genus; moreover, they are not even
   congeneric with each other. According to our morphological observations,
   including the gonopods, Riukiupeltis uenoi is closer to the widespread
   Chamberlinius hualienensis Wang, 1956, hence we propose the new
   combination Chamberlinius uenoi (Murakami, 1975), comb. n. Riukiupeltis
   falcatus, on the other hand, represents a separate, as yet monotypic,
   genus Simplogonomorpha gen. n., distinct both from Haplogonosoma
   Broelemann, 1916 sensu Golovatch et al. (1995), and from Verhoeff's
   original Riukiupeltis. Additionally, Simplogonomorpha falcata (Attems,
   1953), comb. n is re-described here based on fresh material from
   Vietnam. A key and colour habitus-illustrations to all three species are
   also provided here.
C1 Nguyen, Anh D.; Institute of Ecology and Biological Resources, No18,
   Hoangquocviet Road, Caugiay District, Hanoi, Vietnam, Vietnam.
EM ducanh@ierb.ac.vn
RI Nguyen, Duc Anh/I-1960-2014; Korsos, Zoltan/AAH-5861-2019; Nguyen, Duc
   Anh/D-2742-2009
OI Korsos, Zoltan/0000-0003-1545-5086; Nguyen, Duc Anh/0000-0001-9273-0040

SN 1313-2970

   Description; Combination; Taxonomy; Taxonomic position; Key; Land zones;
   Oriental region; Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Asia
DE Riukiupeltis [Japan / Ryukyu Archipelago / Revision] [Vietnam /  / ]. 
TN Arthropods; Invertebrates; Myriapods
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Myriapoda, Diplopoda
OR Chamberlinini - Wang 1956 (Diplopoda): [Diagnostic characters of
   subordinate taxa, P. 32; Key to genera, Males, taxa close to
   Chamberlinius, p. 35]. 
   Chamberlinius uenoi - (Murakami 1975) (Diplopoda): [Comb nov,
   Transferred from Riukiupeltis, p. 29]. 
   Haplogonosoma falcatum - Attems 1953 (Diplopoda): [Designated type
   species for new genus, Simplogonomorpha, p. 31]. 
   Riukiupeltis - Verhoeff 1939 (Diplopoda): [Revision, P. 25]. 
   Riukiupeltis falcatus - (Attems 1953) (Diplopoda): [Referred to, New
   genus Simplogonomorpha, p. 33]. 
   Riukiupeltis uenoi - Murakami 1975 (Diplopoda): [Referred to,
   Chamberlinius, p. 29].

   species Haplogonosoma falcatum Attems 1953, p. 31]. 
   Simplogonomorpha falcata - (Attems 1953) (Diplopoda): [Redescription, P.

UT ZOOREC:ZOOR14802016313

PT J
AN ZOOR14802016324
DT Article; Meeting paper
TI Two remarkable new species of Penicillata (Diplopoda, Polyxenida) from
   Table Mountain National Park (Cape Town, South Africa).
AU Nguyen Duy-Jacquemin, Monique (monguyen@mnhn.fr) 
   Uys, Charmaine
   Geoffroy, Jean-Jacques
SO ZooKeys
VL 156
SU (Special Issue)
PS 85-103
PD 2011
PY 2011
UR http://www.pensoft.net/journals/zookeys/issue/156/
AW http://www.pensoft.net/inc/journals/download.php?fileId=3598&fileTable=J
   _GALLEYS
LA English
U1 0
U2 2
AB Two new species of the families Polyxenidae and Synxenidae, are
   described from Table Mountain National Park, South Africa. Propolyxenus
   squamatus sp. n. (Polyxenidae) has tergites I[long dash]X mostly covered
   by scale[long dash]shaped trichomes directed caudally, a character
   previously known only in Synxenidae. The structure of scale[long
   dash]shaped dorsal trichomes is different to that of the scales in
   Phryssonotus and Condexenus species. Phryssonotus brevicapensis sp. n.
   (Synxenidae) is the only known species of the genus Phryssonotus having
   11 tergites, (including collum and telson) and 15 pairs of legs, as in
   Condexenus biramipalpus Nguyen Duy[long dash]Jacquemin, 2006. These two
   species therefore appear to occupy an intermediate position between
   Phryssonotus (12 tergites) and Polyxenoidea (maximum of 11 tergites).
C1 Nguyen Duy-Jacquemin, Monique; Museum National d'Histoire Naturelle,
   Departement Systematique et Evolution, Section Arthropodes, UMR7205
   OSEB, CP 53, 57 rue Cuvier, 75231 PARIS cedex 05, France, France.
EM monguyen@mnhn.fr
SC Zoology
SN 1313-2970
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Land zones; Afrotropical region;
   Africa
DE Phryssonotus brevicapensis; Propolyxenus squamatus [South Africa /  /
   New species]. 
TN Arthropods; Invertebrates; Myriapods
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Myriapoda, Diplopoda

PT J
AN ZOOR14802016327
PM 22303098
DT Article; Meeting paper
TI The genus Unixenus Jones, 1944 (Diplopoda, Penicillata, Polyxenida) in
   Australia.
AU Short, Megan (mshort@deakin.edu.au) 
   Huynh, Cuong
SO ZooKeys
VL 156
SU (Special Issue)
PS 105-122
PD 2011
PY 2011
UR http://www.pensoft.net/journals/zookeys/issue/156/
AW http://www.pensoft.net/inc/journals/download.php?fileId=3568&fileTable=J
   _GALLEYS
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB The penicillate genus Unixenus Jones, 1944 is widespread, with species
   found in Africa, Madagascar, India and Australia. Each of the two
   Australian species was originally described from single samples from
   Western Australia. In this study, collections of Penicillata from
   museums in all states of Australia were examined to provide further
   details of the two described species, to revise the diagnoses for both
   the genus and the species, and to better understand the distribution of
   the two species in Australia. In addition, two new species Unixenus
   karajinensis sp. n. and Unixenus corticolus sp. n. are described.
C1 Short, Megan; Deakin University, 221 Burwood Hwy, Burwood, Melbourne,
   Australia, Australia.
EM mshort@deakin.edu.au
RI Huynh, Cuong/AAK-3360-2020
OI Huynh, Cuong/0000-0002-2571-4507
SC Zoology
SN 1313-2970
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Diagnosis; Description; Taxonomy;
   Key; Land zones; Australasian region; Australasia; Australia
DE Unixenus [Australia /  / Distribution; new record; systematics]. 
   Unixenus corticolus [New South Wales /  / New species] [Tasmania /  / ]
   [Victoria /  / ]. 
   Unixenus karajinensis [Western Australia /  / New species].

ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Myriapoda, Diplopoda

   species, P. 121; New record]. 
   Unixenus attemsi - Nguyen Duy-Jacquemin & Conde 1967 (Diplopoda):
   [Redescription, P. 108]. 
   Unixenus corticolus (Diplopoda): [Sp nov, Victoria, P. 117]. 
   Unixenus karajinensis (Diplopoda): [Sp nov, Western Australia, P. 113]. 
   Unixenus mjoebergi - (Verhoef 1924) (Diplopoda): [Redescription, P.
   111].

PT J

PM 22291510
DT Article
TI Review of subtribe Singilina Jeannel, 1949, of the Middle East and
   Central Asia (Coleoptera, Carabidae, Lebiini).
AU Anichtchenko, Alexander (beetl2000@mail.ru) 
SO ZooKeys
VL 155
PS 1-50
PD 2011
PY 2011
UR http://www.pensoft.net/journals/zookeys/issue/155/
AW http://www.pensoft.net/inc/journals/download.php?fileId=3574&fileTable=J
   _GALLEYS
LA English
U1 0
U2 4
AB Species of the genus Singilis Rambur, 1837 (Phloeozeteus Peyron, 1856,
   syn. n., Agatus Motschulsky, 1845, syn. n.), occurring in the Middle
   East and Central Asia are reviewed, with 24 species now recognized in
   the region, including ten species described as new: S. makarovi sp. n.
   (Tajikistan), S. jedlickai sp. n. (Afghanistan), S. kolesnichenkoi sp.
   n. (Iran), S. kabakovi sp. n. (Afghanistan, Iran), S. timuri sp. n.
   (Uzbekistan), S. klimenkoi sp. n. (Iran), S. saeedi sp. n. (Iran), S.
   felixi sp. n. (UAE), S. kryzhanovskii sp. n. (Iran, Turkmenistan), and
   S. timidus sp. n. (Iran); S. libani (Sahlberg, 1913) is recognized as a
   valid species; and S. solskyi nom. n. is proposed as a replacement name
   for Agatus bicolor (Solsky, 1874, not Rambur, 1837), now placed in
   Singilis as junior homonym. New synonymies include: Singilis cingulatus
   (Gebler, 1843) = Singilis jakeschi Jedlicka, 1967, syn. n.; S.
   mesopotamicus Pic, 1901 = Singilis apicalis Jedlicka, 1956, syn. n. A
   key to species is provided. Habitus and aedeagal illustrations are
   provided for all species. Distributional data include many new country
   records.

DT Article
TI Pachybrachis sassii, a new species from the Mediterranean Giglio Island
   (Italy) (Coleoptera, Chrysomelidae, Cryptocephalinae).
AU Montagna, Matteo (matteo.montagna@unimi.it) 
SO ZooKeys
VL 155
PS 51-60
PD 2011
PY 2011
UR http://www.pensoft.net/journals/zookeys/issue/155/
AW http://www.pensoft.net/inc/journals/download.php?fileId=3577&fileTable=J
   _GALLEYS
LA English
U1 0
U2 5
AB Pachybrachis sassii, new species is described from Giglio Island, of the
   Tuscan Archipelago (Italy). The new species belongs to the nominotypical
   subgenus and is closely related to P. salfi Burlini, 1957, from which it
   difers in the shape of the median lobe of the aedeagus and in the
   pattern of the yellow raised spots on the elytra and pronotum.
   Ecological observations are made. The neotype of P. salfi from
   Colloreto, Monte Pollino (Italy) is designated.
C1 Montagna, Matteo; DIPAV, Sezione di Patologia Generale e Parassitologia,
   Facolta di Medicina Veterinaria, Universita degli Studi di Milano,
   Italy, Italy.
EM matteo.montagna@unimi.it
OI Montagna, Matteo/0000-0003-4465-7146
SC Zoology
SN 1313-2970

   zones; Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Europe
DE Pachybrachis (Pachybrachis) [Italy /  / Key to species]. 
   Pachybrachis (Pachybrachis) sassii [Italy /  / New species]. 
TN Arthropods; Beetles; Insects; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Coleoptera, Polyphaga, Chrysomeloidea,
   Chrysomelidae
OR Pachybrachis (Pachybrachis) - Dejean 1836 (Chrysomelidae): [Key to
   species, Italy, Selected species, p. 52]. 
   Pachybrachis (Pachybrachis) sassii (Chrysomelidae): [Sp nov, Italy, P.
   53]. 
   Pachybrachis salfii - Burlini 1957 (Chrysomelidae): [Neotype designated,
   P. 59].

DT Article
TI New genus and species of flea beetles (Coleoptera, Chrysomelidae,
   Galerucinae, Alticini) from Puerto Rico, with comments on flea beetle
   diversity in the West Indies and a key to the West Indian Monoplatini
   genera.
AU Konstantinov, A.S. (alex.konstantinov@ars.usda.gov) 
   Konstantinova, A.A.
SO ZooKeys
VL 155
PS 61-87
PD 2011
PY 2011
UR http://www.pensoft.net/journals/zookeys/issue/155/
AW http://www.pensoft.net/inc/journals/download.php?fileId=3580&fileTable=J
   _GALLEYS
LA English
U1 0
U2 3
AB A new genus (Borinken) and five new species (Borinken elyunque,
   Distigmoptera chamorrae, Kiskeya elyunque, Ulrica eltoro, and U. iviei)
   from Puerto Rico are described and illustrated. A key to all West Indian
   Monoplatini genera is provided, as are keys to all species of Kiskeya
   and to the species of Ulrica from Puerto Rico. A list of the flea beetle
   genera, along with the number of species and some of the faunal features
   is presented and discussed for the West Indies.
C1 Konstantinov, A.S.; (ASK) Systematic Entomology Laboratory, PSI,
   Agricultural Research Service, U.S. Department of Agriculture, c/o
   Smithsonian Institution, P.O. Box 37012, National Museum of Natural
   History, MRC 168 Washington, DC 20013-7012, USA, USA.
EM alex.konstantinov@ars.usda.gov

SN 1313-2970

   Neotropical region; Central America; West Indies
